oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pigeon-Proofing Goodwill Manor, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1962, Vol. 2 p. 62
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of men pigeon-proofing Goodwill Manor, located on the Tennessee Agricultural and Industrial State University (now Tennessee State University). Built in 1912, this colonial, two-story residence served as a home for two of the school's presidents: William Jasper Hale (from 1912-1943) and Walter Strother Davis (from 1943-1968). Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1962. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
